items.title: Hanging pictures according to Feng Shui
items.summary: Pictures and collages give a room a personal touch. And they create a very specific atmosphere. A picture says more than words and can evoke different emotions. It can liven up a room or create a calm mood. Pictures can therefore be used excellently in…
items.content_html:
Pictures and collages give a room a personal touch. And they create a very specific atmosphere. A picture says more than words and can evoke different emotions. It can liven up a room or create a calm mood. Pictures can therefore be used excellently in the spirit of Feng Shui to bring Qi into your home. We explain what you should consider when placing pictures in the spirit of Feng Shui .

When designing walls in accordance with Feng Shui, it is not only important how much and what is hung, but also where the pictures are placed.

Feng Shui is known to be applicable to a wide range of areas, from the location and architecture of the house to decoration and wall art. In fact, in terms of Feng Shui, no one is doing themselves any favors by having empty walls. On the other hand, it is not good for the Qi if too much is hanging on the walls. This could lead to a disruption of the energy flow and cause fatigue more quickly.

The selection of images

It all starts with the selection of images. Before you have your photos and posters printed or buy paintings and drawings, you should think carefully about which motifs have a positive effect on you. For example, if you love old family photos, you should look within yourself and ask yourself whether the old black and white photos with the serious-looking people evoke the mood in you that you want in your home.

It is also important that a motif fits the Feng Shui room . The overall picture must appear harmonious and coherent. It is helpful if a picture or a collage reflects the basic idea of ​​a room. A picture of a pond fits in the bathroom, and photos of the family fit in the living room.

According to the principles of Feng Shui, it is usually better to work with several small pictures arranged as a harmonious collage, rather than with a single large picture, which can easily appear “overwhelming”.

Classic Feng Shui images  show bamboo, koi fish, the Chinese dragon or Buddha, for example. These images can be used to attract wealth and prosperity. In general, natural motifs are extremely popular in Feng Shui.

Orientation according to the cardinal directions

When hanging the pictures, you can use the cardinal directions as a guide. This is because the cardinal directions are aligned with certain energies that the corresponding elements can make use of.

The element water

In Feng Shui, the element of water in a room is associated with career and success. According to Feng Shui principles, pictures with water elements are recommended for hanging on a north wall in order to use the positive energies for success. Wall pictures with rivers, waterfalls or sea motifs are good for strengthening the element of water in a room. This can be a painting or a photo from your last beach holiday that you can have printed as a poster .

The element fire

The fire element stands for rank, fame and prestige. The south wall is therefore associated with the element of fire. It is supposed to bring together positive energies for this area of ​​life. Where there is fire, there is usually a need for wood. This is also suitable for south walls. Pictures of trees and forests are therefore suitable. A little "trick" can be to frame a picture in a wooden frame. Water motifs should generally be avoided, because if the fire element is to be strengthened, the water element is counterproductive.

The element wood

In Feng Shui, the wood element corresponds to health and family and has the greatest effect in the east. An east wall should therefore not be left empty. A collection of pictures that promote vitality and awaken positive energies are perfect for the east wall. Anything that feels good is allowed. These can be photos of nature or pictures of loved ones.

The element metal

Metal represents clarity and is strongest in the West. It is strengthened by the colors gold, silver and white. Harmony is important here, but bolder metal artwork and round ornaments in a metallic frame can provide structure.

Tip: The choice of frame for a picture should not be neglected in terms of Feng Shui. It should harmonize with the painting, photo or poster print in terms of color and shape and create a good overall picture.

The wall facing the bed

It is the first thing you see when you wake up and the last thing you see in the evening before you go to sleep: the wall facing the bed. In the spirit of Feng Shui , an inspiring wall picture is particularly important in the bedroom . What inspires you is something you can and should interpret very personally.

Pictures of symbols or people that give you confidence are particularly suitable. A motivational quote is also conceivable. The colors of the wall facing the bed should be calming. 

Beige, peach, light blue and green tones and also a soft brown are suitable. You should especially avoid pictures that appear gloomy and can cause fear and sadness. According to the principles of Feng Shui, a mirror is also considered a bad choice for the wall opposite the bed.

 

The wall in the office

What you see is what you get. According to the principles of Feng Shui, the wall in your Feng Shui office should bring positive energy and not block you. We look at this wall so often over a large part of the day. And at a time of the day when we need inspiration and motivation. 

Therefore, the same approach applies as for the bedroom wall. It is also conceivable to have a vision board created according to the principles of Feng Shui, on which goals, wishes and dreams are lovingly recorded using beautiful motifs and symbols.

items.title: Designing your Feng Shui Garden
items.summary: Feng Shui for the house or garden? GI sit in my garden again and watch the birds and insects on their wonderful journey through nature. Today it will be an article about garden design according to Feng Shui. Many of my clients want to have…
items.content_html:
Feng Shui for the house or garden?

GI sit in my garden again and watch the birds and insects on their wonderful journey through nature. Today it will be an article about garden design according to Feng Shui.

Many of my clients want to have either just the garden or just the house aligned according to Feng Shui criteria. However, there is a close connection between the two, because the external environment of the house plays a decisive role in the building.

If it is difficult for anything to grow outside in the garden, you can assume that there is little energy inside the house as well.

The garden plays an essential role in Feng Shui

From here, the energy and Qi are channeled to the house, which ultimately determines its quality in the house. 

But what exactly do I, as a classic Feng Shui consultant , understand by garden design according to Feng Shui?
I am not a gardener. The type of soil and the plants growing in the garden are not decisive for garden design according to Feng Shui .

Of course, plants should grow, otherwise the life energy would not flow. Every country has its own specific plant world . And every soil also requires its own nature. I had to learn that in my garden too.

At the beginning of a garden design according to Feng Shui, I explore the surrounding landscape

Mountains and trees and also neighboring buildings are examined first. Then the garden is examined in particular.

This approach is essential, so here is an overview of the perfect Feng Shui landscape design.

A shelter at the back of the house. A nice, spacious area at the front towards the entrance . And shelter on both sides, right and left of the house.

I call this principle the Feng Shui armchair. You should sit as if you were in a comfortable armchair so that nothing can attack you from behind and you have a wide view of the front. You want to be able to rest your arms on the right and left.

For my blog post, I was inspired by the placement in the individual  rooms. Because every room has a different function, the mirror should always be used consciously.

Your house should be like you

It needs protection from behind and from the sides so that the rising winds do not endanger the house. There should be a spacious area in front of your house that accompanies your guests to the entrance and supplies the house with good Feng Shui energy.

It is important that the mountains or houses to the right and left of the house are sufficiently far away. The protection from the sides should not be too extreme. For example, another building that shades your house and thus seems rather oppressive.
Once you have looked at your external area, we can now turn to garden design according to Feng Shui.


Before I take out the Feng Shui geomancer compass to determine the cardinal directions, I let my gaze wander through the garden.

The garden says a lot about the residents of the house

If the grass is green and fruity and flowers and bushes are growing lushly, the Qi of the place is powerful. If the earth is too moist even though it hasn't rained, the dampness will also be found in the house.

Trees in particular provide a good indication of geomantic fault zones. If fruit trees in particular split, this indicates earth faults.

In Europe, there is an old farmer’s rule regarding thunderstorms: “You should seek out beeches and avoid oaks.”

Lightning often strikes at water vein crossing points

During a thunderstorm, you should try not to stand under an oak tree, because unlike beech trees, oak trees tend to stand in what are known as disturbance zones.
Trees also reveal a lot about the garden and, above all, what is under the ground. If trees grow crookedly or very poorly, this is always an indication of the Qi in the earth.

Insects and some animals are also always an indication of possible negative earth rays. Ants, cats and bees, for example, love places that we humans should avoid. All of these criteria are very informative when choosing a possible building site and also help when deciding on the right place to stay in the garden.

My eye as a Feng Shui consultant looks even deeper:

Does a terrain slope upwards or downwards? This condition influences the behavior of the water when it rains and it immediately becomes clear whether it is possible to build an artificial watercourse.

In ancient China, a Feng Shui garden would have been unthinkable without water. Today, garden design according to Feng Shui looks a little different. On the one hand, a garden pond can be a source of danger for small children in the house. On the other hand, a watercourse in a Feng Shui garden is beautiful but requires a lot of maintenance.

You can follow a few simple rules for water placement

Water to the right and left of your entrance is also not beneficial to the energy.

This formation is called “crying water” and indicates many tears that will flow in the house.

Likewise, your pond should not be planned exactly behind the house

Stability should be provided by a mountain, hill or elevation. A pond to the left behind the house would be possible, however.

In traditional Feng Shui there are many secret formulas that show which direction a water flow should have. Whether the water flows from right to left or from left to right is extremely important. The orientation of the entrance door is crucial here. The directions of the door are measured according to 24 possible directions and the corresponding Feng Shui water formula is used depending on the orientation. This requires a lot of experience and a good geomantic compass .

It seems easier to create a pond according to Feng Shui

But here too, inflows and outflows or a waterfall could stimulate the Qi. Water in the wrong place can lead to misfortune. Increased accidents, fraud and loss of money are often related to the stimulation of the wrong Qi.

The Feng Shui route to the house is simpler

A winding, meandering path leads the Qi to the house in a harmonious way. Here, too, there are formulas to be read on my Feng Shui compass . The cardinal directions are the decisive factor. Each house has its own orientation and therefore its own formula. This indicates exactly where the path to the house should start and how the path around the house should be.

A simple Feng Shui rule for routing is not to make the path to the house too long or too narrow. This will speed up the Qi and cause unrest and discomfort in the house.

The garden gate

When choosing a garden gate, it is important to remember that the passage is wide. Plants that block the passage should be cut back or even moved.

The garden fence

Garden fences should also be chosen carefully. Pointed and angular shapes, especially if they resemble a spear, indicate what is known as Sha Qi. This negative shape is seen as a harbinger of bad luck. The harmonious image of a hedge would be more favorable instead. Hedges made of bamboo deserve special attention, as they are considered to be harbingers of good luck. Bamboo grows luxuriantly and its leaves are soft in shape.

Planning a garden according to Feng Shui is a lot of fun and also has a positive effect on the neighbors.

items.title: Your home garden – your balcony becomes your oasis of well-being!
items.summary: A balcony can enrich the quality of life in any season. With the right design ideas, the storage area for water crates becomes an additional living space that conveys a holiday feeling and provides fresh energy. A balcony can be an oasis of relaxation all…
items.content_html:
A balcony can enrich the quality of life in any season. With the right design ideas, the storage area for water crates becomes an additional living space that conveys a holiday feeling and provides fresh energy.

Balcony planting: How to make your balcony your favourite place

A balcony can be an oasis of relaxation all year round. Healthy, thriving plants exude positive energy and provide strength. Combine evergreen and winter-hardy plants such as cypresses or flowering flowers that tolerate sun and heat. 

The choice of color depends on your preferences. It is ideal if there is always something blooming and rich, green colors provide lively energy.

Choose plants that are suitable for their location so that they feel comfortable on your balcony. Perennials and sun-loving flowers as well as shade-loving shrubs are grateful for a lovingly and appropriately selected spot. If you want to avoid stress with watering, you could also install automatic watering systems.

The balcony as a snack garden

Fresh herbs, vegetables and fruit are not just reserved for garden owners. Self-sufficiency is the trend. 

A snack garden is a real urban highlight and can be quickly set up on a balcony or a small terrace. From a Feng Shui perspective , healthy and natural food is full of vitality and helps to activate the Qi.   Various buckets in different colors and sizes are an ideal solution. 

If you want to make good use of the limited space on your balcony, you could later enjoy crispy vegetables from your own garden. It's great fun to watch plants and fruit grow - and home-grown fruit tastes incomparably good! 

Small fig and olive trees in attractive planters, which even bear fruit, create a Mediterranean flair and holiday feeling. Pleasantly fragrant Mediterranean herbs such as rosemary and thyme attract bees and other beneficial insects. 

If you like, you can always meet your need for fresh herbs by planting a bucket with your favorite herbs. Hanging plant baskets are also suitable for this. In Feng Shui, every room, including the balcony, should provide good energy and vitality, so you should treat every part of your living space with care.

Keeping order on the balcony

There is never enough space. Unfortunately, many balconies are so small that creativity is limited. 

Before you invest in the design of your balcony, you first need to tidy up. The smaller the balcony, the more important one thing is from a Feng Shui perspective : order . 

No matter how tempting it is to quickly remove the rubbish or deposit bottles from sight and put them on the balcony when it rains - it looks unsightly and blocks energy, which cannot circulate freely. 

A balcony looks tidier when plants and furniture are arranged in small groups.

How can I decorate my balcony?

Many balconies face south because of the sunshine. A south-facing balcony pampers the resident with warmth and brightness. 

Larger balconies offer space for seating sets where you can relax and enjoy warm summer evenings. But you can also find space for suitable furniture on a small balcony. 

According to the motto “less is more”, all places and corners of the balcony should be freely accessible. This is practical and allows the energy to circulate freely in Feng Shui . 

Sharp edges pose a risk of injury – balcony furniture with rounded corners, on the other hand, brings harmony to the balcony. A combination of different materials, colors or structures creates excitement. For example, strong and subtle colors can be combined.

Observe yourself. See how you are and feel inside yourself.

items.title: Feng Shui Mirror: Tips and Tricks
items.summary: No other home accessory is as hotly debated as the mirror in Feng Shui. In almost every home consultation I am asked: “Where should the mirror be placed in Feng Shui?” I know from experience from the many Feng Shui consultations I have given to many of my clients how sensitive…
items.content_html:
No other home accessory is as hotly debated as the mirror in Feng Shui. In almost every home consultation I am asked:

“Where should the mirror be placed in Feng Shui?”

I know from experience from the many Feng Shui consultations I have given to many of my clients how sensitive this topic is. I wonder whether it is our own image that is reflected and prompts us to look for a well-chosen place.

Anyone who enjoys observing themselves knows that not every reflection looks benevolent.

The angle and the light play an important role in how we look. If the light is too bright, many  wrinkles become  visible and the angle determines whether a silhouette is thick or thin. Individual purchasing decisions can depend on the placement of the mirror. The viewer wants to see themselves as pretty and attractive.

For my blog post, I was inspired by the placement in the individual rooms . Because every room has a different function, the mirror should always be used consciously.

This is what you should know about mirrors in Feng Shui.

A very important criterion for the correct placement is what is reflected in the mirror. Avoid all negative features that you see in it. These can be sharp, broken and pointed objects. Corners and edges of wall projections should also be avoided. The garbage can and other musty and broken things should not be visible in it.

Let's walk through the apartment and look at it room by room.

A very important criterion for the correct placement is what is reflected in the mirror. Avoid all negative features that you see in it. These can be sharp, broken and pointed objects. Corners and edges of wall projections should also be avoided. The garbage can and other musty and broken things should not be visible in it.

1. Entrance and hallway area

You've probably experienced this when you enter a room and back away because you think someone is already there. In the end, it's just your own reflection that looks back at you. There shouldn't be a mirror opposite the entrance . The good Qi is reflected and immediately retreats outside.

2 Bedrooms

The Feng Shui bedroom should appear calm and harmonious. In Feng Shui, any reflection is an activator of Yang energy. Avoid mirrors that reflect the bed . Large mirror surfaces on the cupboards and walls cause unrest.

With a mirror, the bed and the people sleeping in it are doubled. Symbolically, you are no longer alone with your partner in the room. Marital problems can already become apparent here.

Since most bedrooms also have a closet, a mirror is desirable. This could be attached to the inside of the closet door. When the closet is closed, there is no reflection.

This was often the case with old farmhouse cupboards. Even chests of drawers with mirrors used to have a folding function so that the mirror could be folded away again at night.

An old Chinese saying goes that the soul travels in the evening and when it returns it is frightened by the mirror. This means that part of the soul may not arrive.
It is also said that we free ourselves of energetic waste during sleep. But this cannot happen if the discharged energy is reflected back.

An old proverb in China says that the soul goes on a journey in the evening and when it returns, it would be frightened in the mirror.

3. Living room

Mirrors should also be avoided in the seating area of ​​the Feng Shui living room  . It is extremely unpleasant to keep seeing ourselves in the mirror while we are sitting on the couch. It can also disrupt a pleasant conversation with our visitors. The viewer will feel like they are being watched by their own reflection in the mirror and will focus on their own image.

Experience report

I can still remember a time when I was asked to go into the living room for a consultation . There was a table with several chairs and on the opposite side there was a wall-sized mirror. I could look at myself from top to bottom. My client didn't notice this.

He was used to always seeing his reflection in the mirror. But for me it was a strange situation because I didn't feel comfortable with it.

I had the feeling that there was another person in the room . I couldn't imagine sitting on the couch that was also there and relaxing. This room was filled with too much Yang energy. This made my customer restless and lacking in energy. As Feng Shui consultants, we always try to create a balance. Too much Yang can be just as exhausting as too much Yin energy.

4. Kitchen

If the stove is located opposite the main entrance, in Feng Shui we speak of the tiger opening its mouth. This is not desirable, as it can bring losses to the household. A well-placed mirror can help here. This way the Qi of the stove can be directed away from the kitchen entrance without escaping.

If the dining area is in the Feng Shui kitchen , it is not desirable to have a mirror there. This is because we use many objects in the kitchen such as knives, scissors and other sharp utensils. These should not be reflected under any circumstances, otherwise the risk of accidents increases.

5. Dining room

The table on which the food is served should be doubled. A mirror would be ideal here. It means wealth , double happiness and that food is available in abundance. However, care should be taken to ensure that it is a beautiful sight opposite the mirror. A mirror is more than just a Feng Shui decoration .

6. Children's and youth rooms

There should be no mirrors in the Feng Shui children's room , as they cause unrest and turbulence. A child's room needs peace and security; too many objects, such as toys and school supplies, would double up in the mirror. This can create chaos.

7. Office

In Feng Shui, a mirror should not be placed opposite the  workplace  . If the Feng Shui office is a very small room , then a well-placed mirror can of course make it appear larger. However, the direct field of vision at the workplace should not have a mirrored wall.

It is beneficial to enter the  room  with full awareness . Some objects are no longer noticed. They have always been in that place. Only things that we pay attention to come back into our consciousness.

This is how many unfavorable factors creep in and affect our lives. Ultimately, the room, every object and every person affects us. By consciously perceiving and understanding how things work, you have control over them in Feng Shui .

Observe yourself. See how you are and feel inside yourself. Then you will find out for yourself where the right place for the mirror is.

items.title: The Feng Shui kitchen – pleasure for the senses!
items.summary: There are things that affect us both positively and negatively when we get up in the morning. Contrary to popular belief, it is not just the fact that we got up on the wrong side of the bed. Or the various tasks, even unpleasant ones,…
items.content_html:
There are things that affect us both positively and negatively when we get up in the morning. Contrary to popular belief, it is not just the fact that we got up on the wrong side of the bed. Or the various tasks, even unpleasant ones, that we still have to do. Maybe the conversation with our children's teacher . The workload that we have ahead of us.

All of this is not what brings down the mood or makes the still tired head wobble. It is the temporal change in the daily changing Qi quality (energy values).

One of these energy influences is, to give just one example, that of the moon. The moon causes the tides on Earth and thus sets huge masses of water in motion every day and is therefore one of the “phenomena” that we feel every day.

By now everyone knows that Feng Shui has something to do with China.

There are enough books that want to teach us more about Feng Shui .
However, reading books is the wrong approach if I want to learn about Feng Shui in depth. Many books on the European market deal with this science in a very superficial way. Especially if I want to learn the teachings of Feng Shui .

These metaphysical studies, which are thousands of years old, were passed on from grand masters to students. The environmental theory can also be found in European culture, in old churches and monasteries. Churches were built in places of particularly strong power anyway. This gives an idea of ​​how highly developed architecture and landscape observation were and are.

The ancient Chinese science is used to improve the energy values ​​of living spaces and the people who live there. Questions such as: In which direction do we look? Where and how the rooms and furnishings should be placed can be calculated using numerous Feng Shui formulas .

How do I plan a Feng Shui kitchen?

This is a question I am often asked, and there are already “ready-made Feng Shui kitchens” on the market. But how does the kitchen planner know how and where the Feng Shui kitchen is placed in the house ?

Do interior designers or kitchen planners ask you whether your kitchen is located in the north of the house or in the northeast?

Do they also ask for the birth date or the exact degree of the house alignment? These are used as the basis for the associated calculation of the Qi qualities (energy values).

It becomes clear that the whole thing is not so simple after all. There are many other factors that need to be considered, measured and calculated before the Feng Shui consultant is finally ready to say: “This is where the stove goes” or “This would be the best place for your Feng Shui kitchen”!

Feng Shui?

Some tips from the so-called "Esoteric Feng Shui" or "American New Age Feng Shui". Books like "Cleaning Up and Decluttering" are great tips for getting your household back in shape and making some changes.

But this has little to do with Feng Shui.

It is also often explained that decorative mobiles should be hung in front of the window so that the Qi does not immediately disappear through the window. Mobiles are nice to look at, but unfortunately they have no Feng Shui basis whatsoever . 

This aspect would now lead to the question of whether Qi is wind or light? Unfortunately, this view has nothing to do with "classic Feng Shui", even if it is said that faith moves mountains. In order to really achieve the effects of Feng Shui, however, a precise analysis of a  Feng Shui consultation is required .

Why is so much attention paid to the kitchen?

The Feng Shui kitchen is the place where food and nourishment for our body is prepared. This is also the place where the element of fire is usually present - the most active element in Feng Shui teachings.

The elements consist of fire, earth, metal, water and wood. When we cook, we need fire.

In traditional Feng Shui, the kitchen symbolizes the prosperity and health of the family.

Why is the position of the stove so important?

Ideally, the kitchen and the fire of the stove are placed in such a way that unfavorable and negative Qi in the room is suppressed or, better said, burned. The arrangement of the kitchen in the house as well as the direction of the kitchen door and the stove are important factors in a Feng Shui consultation. While we suppress unfavorable Qi, we try to activate auspicious Qi at the same time.

So we want to get good Qi in the Feng Shui kitchen and at the same time the kitchen should be in a bad sector that suppresses the Qi. To do this, the kitchen door should be placed in one of the good directions to collect good Qi in the room.

The direction of the stove should also "face" in a good direction. But what is the direction of the stove? In Chinese, that is "the mouth of the fire". But nowadays there is no longer an open flame on the stove, so the front of the oven or stove is considered a reference and orientation point.

How do we find out our favorable and unfavorable directions and sectors?

The directions are based on the "Life Gua" which is calculated from the date of birth (see table below). Each person has four auspicious and four unauspicious directions. For example, a male person born in 1963 belongs to Gua 1 (KAN 1). Ideally, the kitchen for this person should be placed in the southwest and the stove and oven control buttons should face southeast.

And what if different people have different good directions?

The Feng Shui masters in Far Eastern culture agree on this. The focus of the alignment falls on the "breadwinner" of the house. In old Chinese houses, you often find two cooking areas. In fact, people used to cook here for people from the East and West groups (East group Gua 1 / 9 / 3 / 4 - West group Gua 2 / 8 / 7 / 6).

Further tips for kitchen planning:

  • It should be avoided to place the kitchen in the North West sector of the house. If the kitchen is in this sector of the house, it can make it difficult for the man to earn money and his career.
  • No toilet door that opens into the kitchen
  • Avoid bedrooms above the kitchen
  • When cooking, it would be advantageous to have the kitchen door in view
  • The shape of the kitchen, whether round or angular, does not play a major role in Feng Shui . Taste is paramount here.

I look forward to your feedback.
Write to me and tell me what your Feng Shui kitchen looks like.
Enjoy reading.

items.title: Feng Shui Travel
items.summary: It can sometimes be difficult to keep your energy balanced while traveling. Fortunately, these days it is becoming easier to be in tune with yourself and your temporary vacation environment, even while on vacation. For example, there are hotels that are built according to Feng Shui principles…
items.content_html:
It can sometimes be difficult to keep your energy balanced while traveling. Fortunately, these days it is becoming easier to be in tune with yourself and your temporary vacation environment, even while on vacation.

For example, there are hotels that are built according to Feng Shui principles or that have decorated their hotel rooms according to Feng Shui. In this article, you will learn more about how you can stay balanced on vacation and travel without worry.

What is Feng Shui?

Feng Shui is a 3,000-year-old science that originated in China. The literal translation of Feng Shui is "wind and water." In Chinese culture, these two elements are associated with good health. 

Over the years, the concept of Feng Shui has become a symbol of good luck and prosperity. Feng Shui creates harmony between people and their living environment and makes it possible to balance the energy flows in one's personal living environment. 

This allows you to improve your life in a targeted manner. You achieve this balance by designing your environment so that you are in harmony with the natural energy flows. By applying Feng Shui in your living environment, the energy of a certain room can be balanced in order to give the people in that environment health and happiness.

This science is especially popular in Asian culture, where it is known as Tao, which means "the way." Taoism is the study of nature, and the principles of Feng Shui reflect this as well.

The principles of Feng Shui

Feng Shui uses the five natural elements and studies how they work together to keep each other in balance. These are the elements of wood, earth, fire, metal and water. 

Each of these five elements has its own characteristics, colors and shapes. They can be used in your living environment to enhance the qualities associated with these elements.

Earth

Earth is associated with self-care, nutrition, and setting boundaries. Earth elements have earthy colors like brown, yellow, orange, and ochre and are often heavy and square. If you want to use an earth element in your home, you can, for example, place a square or rectangular rug or a large and heavy desk in the room.

Water

Water is the element of connection with others and wisdom. This element is associated with colors such as dark blue and black and has wavy shapes. You can use this element by placing a water fountain in your home or by hanging a painting with wavy or water images.

Metal

Metal is characterized by beauty, accuracy and precision. The colors associated with metal are white, gray and metallic colors. Metal elements have a round shape. To use this element in your home, you can use metal lamps or round metal plant pots.

Fire

Fire is usually associated with visibility, inspiration and passion. Fire is associated with the colors red and bright rose and is expressed in triangular shapes. By experimenting with lighting, you can use the element of fire in your home.

Wood

Wood is the element of vitality, growth and healing. The colors of the wood element are green, blue-green and blue, and the objects are often large and column-shaped. The best way to bring the wood element into the home is with plants.

Applying Feng Shui while traveling

It is certainly easy to apply Feng Shui in your own home, but it is a different story when you are travelling. How can you ensure that everything is in balance when you are travelling? 

First, you need to consider the cardinal directions. When determining favorable or unfavorable travel directions in terms of Feng Shui, it depends on which direction you are traveling from and of course where you are traveling. Therefore, concentrate on your cardinal directions as soon as you 

have arrived at your destination. If possible, try to take a detour along the way so that you can concentrate on the direction that is best for you.

You don't need much to manifest a trip. To awaken your travel Qi, you can, for example, visualize your trip. To strengthen your travel Qi even more, you could put up photos of your travel destination, especially in the north sector of your house or apartment.

When you travel and are away from your usual environment, it is important to protect yourself from negative energy. For example, lock your suitcase with a TSA-certified padlock, tie a red ribbon around the handle of your suitcase and take a red scarf with you to wear while traveling. The red color is more noticeable and also protects you from theft.

Energize your hotel room with Feng Shui

Once you arrive at your hotel room, it can be difficult to set it up the way you want. Hotel rooms are visited by many people and the energy of these people can linger in the room for a long time. 

You can remedy this somewhat by carrying your own personal lucky symbol with you. A photo of a Buddha or your personal spiritual guide offers protection. 

Good thoughts simplify interaction with other people during the trip and provide a feeling of satisfaction and harmony. 

You can also freshen up your hotel room with a candle with a slightly calming scent like lavender to brighten the energy in the room and give it a dose of yang energy. Incense should be used discreetly in the hotel room so as not to set off the fire alarm. On the other hand, scented oils and scented sprays are ideal for creating an immediate feeling of arrival.

Hotels designed according to the principles of Feng Shui

There are some hotels that are completely designed and furnished according to the teachings of Feng Shui.

Here is my very personal story:

More by chance, I recently had the opportunity to work on a very special project. Oh my God! I write "recently", but it was about three or four years ago.

Do you know Madeira?

A dreamy flower island in the Atlantic. Lots of mountains, great scenery, sea views. Far too good for big hotel complexes. That's what my smart customer thought too, who wanted to create a very special hotel out of a row of small, rustic farmhouses in a rustic setting. I was involved in the planning process from the very beginning . The reception, the gardens, the small restaurant, the paths, and even the pool, which stretches over the cliffs, were designed according to Feng Shui criteria. I was also allowed to have a say in the choice of materials and the high-quality furnishings of the now beautiful rooms, which are actually all separate houses.

The result is a very special, very exclusive Feng Shui hotel in which guests can simply feel at home.

 A particular challenge in the project was the issue of water .

The Feng Shui Hotel in New York

Hotels have already been designed according to Feng Shui not only in Madeira but also in Germany.

For example, in Long Island, New York, you will find the Viana Hotel & Spa. This is the only sustainable hotel on Long Island built according to the teachings of Feng Shui. The lobby is designed to exude a sense of positive energy and calm. The rest of the hotel is designed to promote harmony and generate more joy and vitality, with each hotel room designed to provide absolute tranquility.

 What do you need for such orders?

  • The right mindset to recognize opportunities
  • The ability to use contacts correctly
  • Know what is applicable in special situations

Through study and experience, exchange and professional help. I wish you from the bottom of my heart the courage and strength to live your dream job, like I do mine as a Feng Shui consultant.

Well, basically just so you can see what is possible.

Leave in peace and apply for a visa, my personal tip

To ensure you can leave with peace of mind, you should make sure in advance that you have all the necessary travel documents. For example, if you are travelling to New York, you will need an ESTA USA . 

This is an electronic travel authorization that is digitally linked to your passport, eliminating the need to go to an embassy or consulate to apply for a physical visa. Once granted, an ESTA is valid for two years and allows multiple stays of up to three months in the US. However, it is important that you carefully check in advance whether you meet the entry requirements for the US and the requirements for the ESTA .

items.title: The living trends 2024 – Inspirations for Feng Shui furnishing
items.summary: The year 2024 has already started off stressfully with the many crises. Since you will certainly be spending a lot of time at home, it is important that you really feel comfortable. You design the Feng Shui living room according to your own preferences as your refuge…
items.content_html:
The year 2024 has already started off stressfully with the many crises. Since you will certainly be spending a lot of time at home, it is important that you really feel comfortable.

You design the Feng Shui living room according to your own preferences as your refuge to feel safe. You can  find inspiration in the current living trends for 2024. You can find out what is currently popular and how you can design your own home as harmoniously as possible here.

Art Deco replaces Bauhaus in 2024 home trends

 

While the Bauhaus style conquered the houses in 2019, Art Deco is currently making its mark this year . Furniture and accessories have metal feet , while playful patterns on lush textiles add an elegant touch. 

The elegant design shows itself at its best in combination with rich, dark colors such as blue or green. You can complement the elegance of the furnishing style with beautiful textiles or other decorative elements. Velvet cushions and patterned wallpaper are elegant without appearing kitschy in the  2024 home trends.

 

The motto here is to create a pompous and opulent environment. To ensure that your Feng Shui living room  doesn't appear chaotic, don't mix too many colors , patterns and materials, but rather focus on a few favorites. 

Therefore, place beautiful eye-catchers sparingly to avoid a boastful appearance, while at the same time highlighting the individual pieces in a positive way.

Natural accents prevail in the living trends of 2024

 

This year, furniture with wickerwork in various forms is enjoying great popularity. These include, for example:

  • Chairs
  • Bistro tables
  • Sideboards
  • Lamps
 

The Viennese wickerwork design has existed for almost 200 years and is now making a comeback in the interior design scene. The wickerwork made of rattan is supported by modern accessories made of bamboo, raffia or seagrass and is particularly popular in Feng Shui kitchens .

The so-called boho look can therefore be perfectly combined with it, as it is based on precisely these natural materials. In addition, Japanese-style furniture looks good with Viennese wickerwork.

Especially in the Feng Shui bedroom and Feng Shui living room, wickerwork elements create an exotic look that stands out even more with light and earthy tones. However, you should avoid too many intense colors as they cause unrest.

 

Nordic design continues to evolve

 

The Scandinavian interior design style, known in recent years for its minimalist furniture and simple colors, is brightening up this year with a little more color . Instead of the muted white, beige or gray tones, light or white wood is now presented alongside colorful individual pieces . Pastel colors complement the simple design and create real eye-catchers with their contrasts - the Feng Shui office in particular benefits from this .

The Warm Nordic design not only ensures comfort and tranquility through the understated furniture, but also brings life into your home through the various colorful elements. You can set accents, for example, with:

  • A mustard yellow duvet
  • Colorful picture walls above the sofa
  • Pastel colored boxes in the kitchen
 

Further current in minimalism

 

Another trend based on simplicity is "Modern Living". Similar to Nordic design, simple designs and muted colors with a minimalism in mind dominate here . Warm and earthy tones such as beige, gray and brown are in the foreground, with colors such as blue, yellow, green and white occasionally complementing the overall picture.

The focus of the  2024 home trends  is primarily on the origin of the materials. This shows the desire for sustainability and high-quality pieces from environmentally friendly production.

 

The following materials are primarily used:

 
  • rattan
  • Stone
  • Linen
  • Wood
  • Basket
 

These provide peace and comfort, which is why the style is increasingly popular in living rooms and bedrooms .

Organic lamp bases

 

The return to natural materials can also be seen in the lighting . Lamp bases made of wood , glass and ceramic stand out in contrast to urban plastic or metal . 

Here you will find above all fine shapes and playful designs that stylishly round off the trend of elegant furnishings. Especially in an otherwise simple interior design philosophy, wooden lamps provide coziness and act as real eye-catchers.

 

The Glass Revival

 

Glass is not only a great choice for lamps. As a stand-alone decorative element, it doesn't look cold and minimalist this year, but rather boasts beautiful tones and polished structures .

  • Vases
  • Lamps
  • Candlesticks

With a combination of white, copper and gold, they give the entire interior a noble touch.

 

Living trends - Pastel conquers the walls

 

Last year, pastel colors were already an indispensable part of homes . The cheerful colors make a room immediately seem inviting. London Fashion Week crowned the colors "Fiery Red, Peach Pink, Empire Yellow and Love Bird" as the most important colors of the coming year. 

There is also the light green “Classic Green”, the color has a refreshing and cool effect and perfectly complements any pastel shade. On the wall, the color shines even more intensely if you complement it with darker wood or warm gold or copper accents . 

In addition, old pink or a matte yellow can be found on both walls and furniture. Especially in kitchens and dining rooms, the light colors in combination with gold decoration and furniture made of light wood are a real mood-booster .

The Pantone Color Institute, on the other hand, chose the color "Classic Blue" as the most distinctive. In addition to this, other tones such as gray-blue and aqua are becoming increasingly popular because they bring the vastness of the sea into your home and make the rooms appear larger . 

Thanks to the variety of shades of blue, you can find the right color for every room. Combined with terracotta and rich green tones or dark wooden furniture, the sea tones look impressive.

 

The circle closes

 

Away from the corners and edges of last year, round furniture is making its mark this year. The oval shapes and flowing edges create a retro look that doesn't stop at seating and upholstered furniture. They are also being taken into the Feng Shui children's room .

Round lamps and vases suit both modern interiors and older-style apartments . They provide peace and balance and look very classy when combined with dark wood and earth tones.

Bringing the look into your own home is not difficult. If possible, swap out square furniture for round furniture. In smaller steps, it already proves to be effective to swap out accessories and small pieces of furniture for new ones in organic shapes.

items.title: House facades according to Feng Shui – wood, colour and interaction
items.summary: Just like the interior design, the exterior design of a property influences its holistic energetic effect. According to the teachings of Feng Shui, the proportions and shapes of houses reflect those of the body. The facade of an object represents the skin or the face…
items.content_html:
Just like the interior design, the exterior design of a property influences its holistic energetic effect. According to the teachings of Feng Shui, the proportions and shapes of houses reflect those of the body.

The facade of an object represents the skin or the face and – depending on its surface area – has a significant impact on the overall impression. This article shows the essential factors for a wooden facade according to Feng Shui principles.

The skin wants to breathe, the facade too!

The skin is the human organ that covers the largest surface area for sensory perception. Thanks to the associated surface sensitivity, humans can perceive vibrations, pressure, touch and temperatures, for example.

Just as the natural organ is important for maintaining health, houses also need a shell that enables an exchange of energy between the environment and the interior. 

If buildings are over-insulated, this exchange is not possible or only possible to a limited extent. Ideally, the insulation and the design of the house facade are directly included in the planning of the building according to Feng Shui . Materials and constructions as well as colors must be carefully selected.

Good to know: When compared to the human body, windows symbolize the eyes, the front door represents the mouth. The rooms inside the building represent the organs.

 

Wooden facades – use and maintain surfaces effectively

Wood is a popular facade material - not just in Feng Shui. As an element in the theory of harmony, the natural material stands for departure, growth, beginnings, spring, material prosperity and creativity. In order for the element to unfold its positive effect on the facade of buildings, the material should be recognizable and perceptible as such.

  • For example, if a wooden surface is painted in high-gloss white, the wood element cannot achieve its original effect according to Feng Shui.
  • A white painted facade corresponds to the element metal and therefore has a completely different character than the underlying material.
  • Knowledge of what a facade was originally made of is therefore not the only decisive factor for the effect of the building envelope.
  • Visual (seeing), olfactory (smelling) and haptic (feeling) perception are also elementary.

 

An untreated wooden facade retains its wooden character because the material is recognized and perceived as such. In addition to the smell and the color of the wood, the feel plays a role. When you touch the facade, you can feel the warm surface and the characteristic grain.

Wood protection without elemental changes if possible

If the wooden facade is to be protected from external influences such as rain, UV radiation and insects without affecting the perceptible effect of the material, breathable wood protection products such as glazes are a good option.

"In contrast to varnishes, wood protection glazes do not cover the wood surface and therefore also the grain. The wood protection glaze allows the wood to retain its natural appearance and ensures open pores so that the wood surface can continue to breathe . "

says the product information about the effective wood protection glaze from Baufix . The environmentally friendly wood gel from the specialist manufacturer of building protection products based in Heidelberg bears the "Blue Angel" environmental label. The moisture absorbed by the facade wood can be released again thanks to open-pored glazed facade wood - the facade and thus the skin of the building can breathe.

Weathered wood – easy to maintain, but requires intensive planning

A wooden facade without a protective coating develops a grey patina over the years, which gradually becomes darker. Natural wood changes its appearance significantly and this change should be taken into account during planning. The facade structure must be carefully chosen so that the effect remains positive even after years.

 

A significant factor is weathering and the possible color differences associated with it. A canopy or a projection can cause the wooden facade to have different colors on one side of the building. All areas that are less exposed to the weather remain lighter. Poorly positioned joints and slatted structures also contribute to the outer shell looking unsightly after just a few years.

Homeowners who want to save themselves a lot of work in advance make sure that the wooden facade can dry quickly after a downpour when planning the house. This requires forward-looking construction in harmony with the elements and cardinal directions.

 

Charred wood for refined facades

An alternative are pre-weathered wooden boards specifically for facades, which already have an elegant surface when purchased and promise less severe changes. 

An example of this is the wood with Yakisugi treatment , which is sold by the family-run wood producer Nakamoto Forestry from Japan. The wood for facade cladding is preserved by carbonization. In addition to completely black facades, the durable woods are available brushed so that the original wood colors remain visible.

Achieve the desired effect with colours

If a reduction in the wooden surface is desired, the facade can be designed in color. Depending on the color choice, the yin or yang effect of the building can be strengthened. 

If the goal is a Yin-emphasized facade, blue can be a possible color. But be careful: If a strong earth shape of a property meets the water represented by blue, disharmony can result. The reason is that the earth element absorbs water and destroys its power (also known as a collision). Such collisions are consistently avoided in a Feng Shui- compliant design, because otherwise unrest in perception or effect arises.

To achieve a balanced yin-yang character, all factors must be taken into account. The factors here do not just mean materials and colors, but also the residents who live in the property. It is therefore important to take stock and answer the key question of what the new facade paint should achieve.

Including:

  • To which element can the building be assigned based on its shape?
  • How does the house fit into the surroundings?
  • Which element can the environment be assigned to?
  • Should more energy be directed into the house?
  • Is mediation between the environment and the house desired?

When it comes to terraced houses in different colours, it is advisable to carefully consider the interactions. Depending on the colour combinations and house shapes, some houses can benefit from the interaction, while others (and therefore the residents) are negatively influenced.

  • Even rampant plants climbing along the facade or hanging plants reaching down from a balcony into the ground floor windows can significantly detract from the overall impression.
  • In order to direct positive, lively energy into the house, the facade color should not only match the surroundings. With the help of strong accents - for example in the form of a front door in a powerful color - the desired energy flows into the building.

The characters of the residents must also be taken into account when making the color scheme. For example, a homeowner who is born under the Feng Shui element ( Chinese zodiac sign ) of fire will hardly be attracted to a facade that primarily nourishes water elements.

With Feng Shui advice for new buildings, conflicts can be prevented and a pleasant living experience can be promoted right from the start.

items.title: Radiant shine – exploring the magical powers of a Feng Shui bracelet
items.summary: Feng Shui has been considered an art in China for centuries, enabling harmonious living. Feng Shui literally means wind and water. The knowledge of Feng Shui has now reached Europe and more and more people want to design their homes according to the rules of Feng Shui.
items.content_html:
Feng Shui has been considered an art in China for centuries, enabling harmonious living. Feng Shui literally means wind and water.

The knowledge of Feng Shui has now reached Europe and more and more people want to design their homes according to the rules of Feng Shui. But what exactly is Feng Shui? Can you really influence your luck? And how does it all work?

The effect of Feng Shui is proven by years of research and observation!

What is Feng Shui?

Feng Shui is an ancient Chinese art form that recognizes the interaction between spirit and matter. It is about harmonizing the flow of energy in our lives and thus freeing ourselves from disruptive factors.

By harmonizing our external environment, we can refocus our attention on our inner life and concentrate on our actual needs. 

An important part of Feng Shui are bracelets made of metal or stone. These so-called bangle bands are worn on certain parts of the skin and have the function of regulating the flow of energy in the body. This puts more strain on the body and strengthens it, which has a positive effect on our health.

Effect of the Feng Shui Bracelet

The Feng Shui bracelet is a special artifact that has a number of positive effects. It helps us discover and strengthen our magical powers.

It can improve our health and helps us achieve our dreams. The bracelet is a symbol of happiness and harmony. It helps us to be in harmony with ourselves and the world.

How does the bracelet work?

The functions of the bracelet are complex and can vary depending on the manufacturer and model. In general, however, the bracelet is seen as a talisman that brings positive energy into the wearer's life. It is said to bring good luck , health and prosperity. 

Through the combination of gemstones and motifs from Feng Shui, it is also intended to draw attention to certain aspects of life and thus focus on what is essential.

Areas of application of the Feng Shui bracelet

A Feng Shui bracelet is versatile and can be placed in the Feng Shui living room , the Feng Shui office or the garden. Depending on the purpose, the bracelet can be placed in different places. For example, the bracelet can be placed at the front door to regulate the flow of energy in the apartment. 

The Feng Shui bracelet can also have positive effects in the office. Its radiance can brighten up the room and improve the working atmosphere. The Feng Shui bracelet can also be used in the Feng Shui garden . Its magical powers can protect plants from negative influences and help them to become more vital and radiant.

Which stones should be used to achieve the best possible effect?

There are many different stones that can be used in a Feng Shui bracelet. To achieve the best possible effect, it is important to choose carefully. Each stone has its own magical powers and properties. It is important to read up on the meaning of each stone before choosing it. This will help to ensure that the bracelet has the desired effect. 

Some of the most commonly used stones in Feng Shui bracelets are: 

Jade: Jade is a very popular stone in Feng Shui. It is often referred to as a lucky stone and is known for its ability to attract good luck and wealth. Jade can also help promote harmony and balance. 

Crystal: Crystals are known for their healing properties. They can help cleanse and strengthen the body, mind and spirit. Crystals also have the ability to strengthen the aura and ward off negative energies. 

Tourmaline: Tourmaline is a very powerful stone. It is known for its ability to ward off negative energies and strengthen the aura. Tourmaline can also help cleanse the body, mind and soul.

An old saying in China says: a path between two people is a smile!

 

What are the benefits of wearing a Feng Shui bracelet?

One of the best things about a Feng Shui bracelet is that it helps us to understand our own magical powers. By wearing a bracelet that is tailored to our needs, we can use the positive properties of that bracelet to improve our lives. 

For example, a protection bracelet can help us feel safer and overcome our fears. Or a lucky bracelet can help us find more satisfaction in our lives.

Instructions for wearing the bracelet

The bracelet must be worn regularly to unleash its magical powers. Always wear it on your left hand and make sure it does not rub or pinch. The bracelet should never be removed unless you are in bed or bathing. When you wear the bracelet, you will feel it providing you with strength and positive energy. It will inspire you and help you achieve your goals.

  1. Place the bracelet on your wrist and fasten it tightly. 
  2. Make sure that the bracelet is not too tight and that it can be worn comfortably.
  3. If you want to wear the bracelet at night, you should loosen it so that it does not get stuck. 
  4. To achieve the best effect, the bracelet should be worn every day

Conclusion

Feng Shui bracelets are a wonderful way to boost the energy in your life. They improve your well-being and happiness. 

Although it is possible to discover all the details about the magical powers behind Feng Shui bracelets, to understand it you must experience the bracelet yourself. Join the club of those whose lives have changed for the better today. 

Combine the healing powers of nature with the ancient tradition of Feng Shui and increase your productivity and happiness.

Observe how you are doing and feel inside yourself.

items.title: Better quality of life through an individually furnished home
items.summary: A home where you feel comfortable and enjoy being is an essential prerequisite for a high quality of life and the most intense happiness possible. Different aspects such as lighting, wall design, decoration and the position of furniture affect the quality of living. More and…
items.content_html:
A home where you feel comfortable and enjoy being is an essential prerequisite for a high quality of life and the most intense happiness possible.

Different aspects such as lighting, wall design, decoration and the position of furniture affect the quality of living. More and more people are choosing to decorate their homes according to the rules of Feng Shui in order to benefit from positive energies.

I will explain to you which aspects need to be taken into account when furnishing your home in this way.

Happiness depends on two factors: you and your good indoor climate!

Rely on high-quality lighting

Lighting is very important in a home that has been decorated according to Feng Shui rules. Care should be taken to create light-filled rooms to avoid a feeling of being cramped.

It is particularly advisable to rely on natural light. Large windows are useful and the light can be individually controlled using curtains and blinds. In particular, the desk and places where you spend a lot of time, such as the Feng Shui living room, should receive a lot of natural light.

Alternatively, you can use different light sources to illuminate different living areas. It is advisable not to use just one large ceiling light, especially in the Feng Shui bedroom.

This does not meet the individual requirements for tailor-made lighting . Instead, you should always use floor lamps and wall lamps to illuminate a reading corner, for example, and create an ambience that makes you feel comfortable.

Decorate your walls creatively

There are many ways to influence the atmosphere and design of a room through the walls.

For example, many people use Beton Cire to give the plaster an attractive appearance and to use a high-quality and attractive finish . The nice thing about this type of wall design is that it is easy to maintain and moisture-resistant.

In addition, different wall colors can be used to give rooms a special look and to separate different living areas from each other.

It is also a good idea to work with attractive wallpapers in different patterns and with creative designs. This way, a room quickly gets an individual touch and can be adapted to your style and taste.

Another good strategy is to work with attractive moldings. A variety of wall designs can be used throughout the entire apartment, or you can decide to give each room its own look.

The right decoration

The design of an apartment according to the Feng Shui principle depends not only on the walls and a high-quality floor covering , but also the decorative elements play an important role.

These are crucial to the personality of a room and whether it looks modern, traditional, youthful, stylish or futuristic. There are many different decorative items that you can use to design a room.

Among the most popular decorative elements are wall pictures. Here you should choose ones that show positive and nature-related motifs.

Likewise, many people work with attractive figures that are placed on a sideboard or window sill. Another strategy is to work with mirrors.

These can make a room appear larger and give it a particularly bright and appealing touch. However, you should avoid hanging a mirror opposite a door and mirrors are not welcome in a Feng Shui bedroom.

Otherwise it will reflect the positive energy that comes into the room, meaning it cannot be used.

Choose round shapes

Nature is characterized by round shapes. From the largest planets, which are round and orbit the sun in round orbits, to atoms, which are round and also move in round orbits, all elements in the world are basically round.

Round shapes are part of human nature and should play a major role in our lives. That is why it is advisable to use round shapes and to avoid edges and corners in furniture as much as possible.

In addition, by building houses, humans have, to a certain extent, distanced themselves from their original living environment.

That is why, according to the Feng Shui principle, it is important to bring as many natural materials as possible into your living space. This makes it possible to stay in touch with your roots and origins, even in big cities and modern environments, and to achieve the highest possible quality of life in your own home.

There is an old Chinese saying: even if your house has a thousand rooms, you only need one to sleep in.

 

Working with plants

To ensure a high quality of life in your own home, it is advisable to have as many plants as possible.

These bring liveliness and naturalness into your living area and noticeably improve the air quality.

Plants are particularly useful in Feng Shui bedrooms when it comes to improving the room climate and helping you to fall asleep and sleep through the night. Plants also bring a variety of colors into your living area, making it bright and cheerful. 

When selecting plants, their individual characteristics must be taken into account so that they fit perfectly into your living area and personal lifestyle.

Red wood, for example, represents fire in plants. If you want to make your living space warm, passionate and full of joy , you should choose this color. Dark leaves, on the other hand, represent water and bring depth and mobility to the living area.

Pastel-colored flowers, on the other hand, represent metal, which stands for courage and concentration. The element earth is represented by yellow and earth-colored plants and brings stability into your own four walls.

Appeal to all senses as much as possible

Humans have five senses that allow them to perceive their surroundings and improve their quality of life. However, most people often focus too much on their sense of sight, so that the other senses do not reach their full potential.

When furnishing your own living area, you should therefore try to appeal to as many senses as possible .

This can be achieved, for example, through water elements, wind chimes and quiet music. This stimulates the sense of hearing and calms the body and soul .

It is also advisable to work with different room scents. These can provide serenity and relaxation, but can also have an invigorating effect. It is a good idea to have different scents available for different phases of life and different moods.

Conclusion

By designing your own living space, it is easy to influence your personal quality of life and well-being. It is a good idea to follow Feng Shui rules when designing your own four walls.

Particular consideration should be given to lighting, walls, decoration, shapes and plants.
